pkgmetadata.longdescription: # BlueQubit Python SDK## Quick Start1. Register on https://app.bluequbit.io and copy the API token.2. Install Python SDK from PyPI:``` pip install bluequbit```3. An example of how to run a Qiskit circuit using the SDK:``` import qiskit import bluequbit bq_client = bluequbit.init("<token>") qc_qiskit = qiskit.QuantumCircuit(2) qc_qiskit.h(0) qc_qiskit.x(1) job_result = bq_client.run(qc_qiskit, job_name="testing_1") state_vector = job_result.get_statevector() # returns a NumPy array of [0. +0.j 0. +0.j 0.70710677+0.j 0.70710677+0.j]```The packages is tested extensively on Python 3.8.## Full referencePlease find detailed reference at https://app.bluequbit.io/sdk-docs.## Questions and IssuesPlease submit questions and issues to info@bluequbit.io.
